designSystemProfile.name: Retrograde Pixel
designSystemProfile.description: A design system blending 8-bit nostalgia with modern, vibrant gradients. It features a dark mode theme, pixel-perfect typography, and gradient-based accents. The core aesthetic relies on sharp edges, pixelated borders, and colorful text/iconography against a dark background.

global.notes: No shadows, blurs, or border-radius should be used anywhere in this design system to maintain the sharp, pixelated aesthetic. All elements should appear crisp.

h1.notes: Large pixelated gradient text with character spacing. Should look like retro game titles.

h2.comment: For card titles, e.g., 'WHAT WENT WELL'.
h2.notes: Card title text with gradient fill matching the card's border gradient. Should be vibrant and pixel-perfect.

p.comment: For body content inside cards or general text.

a.comment: For navigation and other interactive links.

cards.comment: The core content container. The visual container is defined by its border, not a background fill.

notes.critical: DO NOT apply background color or background gradients to the card itself. The card's content area is transparent, showing the global page background.
notes.implementation: The gradient is applied ONLY to the border. Use the 'border-image-source' CSS property with the appropriate gradient.

primary.comment: For positive or primary content, e.g., 'What Went Well'.

secondary.comment: For cautionary or neutral content, e.g., 'What Didn't Go Well'.

tertiary.comment: For ideas or forward-looking content, e.g., 'Ideas for Improvement'.

buttons.comment: Interactive elements for actions. Hover states should provide clear feedback.

primary.comment: PROPOSED STYLE for primary actions, e.g., 'Submit', 'Create'.

textLink.comment: For secondary actions, like '+ Add a note'.

icons.comment: Icons are pixel art. The style is established by the 'Vintage Mac Wallpaper Sequoia.png' reference.

notes.critical: DO NOT use a single solid color for all icons. Icons should be multicolored and can use any of the defined gradients.
notes.guideline: The color of an icon should thematically match its context. For example, a 'delete' icon might use the secondary (Orchid) palette, while a 'new feature' icon might use the tertiary (Evergreen) palette.

lists.comment: For bulleted or action item lists.

dividers.notes: This can be implemented as an <hr> tag or a border on a container element.

animation.comment: Suggestions for modern animations with Framer Motion, per user request.

cardLoad.effect: Animate cards in with initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 20 }} and animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }} with a short delay between each card.

buttonHover.effect: Use whileHover={{ scale: 1.05 }} for primary buttons. For text links, a subtle background color fade-in.

textRender.effect: For headings, consider a character-by-character stagger animation to simulate a 'typing' effect.
